title: Introduction
description: JavaScript runs asynchronously through an event loop. Let's look at a simple example.

steps.log: The script starts in the global scope. We assign `a` to 1
Functions `foo` and `bar` are added to scope
After 0 ms the `foo` callback is called. Since time is 0, it goes immediately to the callback queue
A second timeout after 1 ms for an anonymous function callback. A timer WebApi waits 1 ms
console will log `a = 1` since no timer callbacks have been called yet
The end of the script is reached
We dequeue the first item in the Callback Queue. We enter a new stack frame of the callback (foo)
A another stack frame is pushed. Variable `a` is set to 2
We reach the end of `bar` and `foo`. Both stack frames are popped
After 1 ms, the setTimeout WebApi enqueues a timeout callback
Since there is nothing on the call stack, the first queue item is added, and a new stack frame is added
